title: Pembrokeshire Family Coastal Adventure
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8 and up who enjoy outdoor activities and are comfortable with water. Those new to adventure sports.
notSuitableFor: Individuals with significant mobility issues or a strong aversion to water activities. Those seeking high-adrenaline thrills.

stops.title: Coasteering Classic with TYF Adventure
stops.description: Explore the coastline by swimming, climbing, and jumping into the sea. TYF provides wetsuits, buoyancy aids, and helmets.

wetAlt.title: St Davids Cathedral Visit
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic cathedral and its surrounding grounds.

budgetAlt.title: Rockpool Exploration at Porthclais Harbour
budgetAlt.description: Discover marine life in the rockpools at low tide. Bring a bucket and a net.

stops.title: The Bishops Kitchen
stops.description: Cafe in St Davids offering classic lunch fare.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Whitesands Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy sandwiches with a stunning view.

stops.title: Surfing Lesson at Whitesands Beach with TYF Adventure
stops.description: Learn to surf with qualified instructors at the beautiful Whitesands Beach, known for its consistent waves.

wetAlt.title: Oriel y Parc Gallery and Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore local art and learn about the Pembrokeshire Coast National Park.

budgetAlt.title: Beach Games at Whitesands Beach
budgetAlt.description: Build sandcastles, play frisbee, or simply relax on the beach.

stops.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
stops.description: Eco-friendly campsite with stunning coastal views, ideal for families who love the outdoors.

budgetAlt.title: Camping at Newgale Campsite
budgetAlt.description: A more basic campsite closer to the beach.

stops.title: Boat Trip - Ramsey Island with Preseli Venture
stops.description: Take a boat trip around Ramsey Island to see seals, seabirds, and stunning coastal scenery.

wetAlt.title: National Trust Tudor Merchant's House (Tenby)
wetAlt.description: Explore a restored 15th-century merchant's house in Tenby.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal Walk along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path
budgetAlt.description: Hike a section of the coast path for free, enjoying the views.

stops.title: The Mill Cafe St Justinians
stops.description: Small cafe near St Justinians offering classic lunches.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic lunch at Abereiddy Blue Lagoon
budgetAlt.description: Bring your own food and enjoy a scenic picnic.

stops.title: Visit Abereiddy Blue Lagoon
stops.description: Enjoy the views of the blue lagoon and walk along the cliffs.

wetAlt.title: Melin Tregwynt Woollen Mill
wetAlt.description: See a traditional Welsh woollen mill in action.

budgetAlt.title: Relax at Blue Lagoon
budgetAlt.description: Walk around the area and enjoy the scenic views.

stops.title: Preseli Venture Eco Lodge
stops.description: Eco-friendly lodge offering comfortable accommodation and a range of activities, perfect for active families.

stops.title: Sea Kayak Safari at Stackpole Quay with Activity Pembrokeshire
stops.description: Explore the stunning coastline by kayak, paddling through caves and around arches with experienced guides.

wetAlt.title: Pembroke Castle Visit
wetAlt.description: Explore the impressive Pembroke Castle, a Norman fortress with a rich history.

budgetAlt.title: Walk from Stackpole Quay to Barafundle Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic coastal walk to the beautiful Barafundle Bay.

stops.title: Stackpole Inn
stops.description: Popular pub and restaurant serving local food.

stops.title: Paddle Boarding at Stackpole/Barafundle with Outer Reef Surf School
stops.description: Learn to paddle board in the calm waters of Stackpole Quay and Barafundle Bay.

wetAlt.title: Bosherston Lily Ponds Walk
wetAlt.description: Explore the beautiful lily ponds and woodland trails.

budgetAlt.title: Swim at Barafundle Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a swim at one of Pembrokeshire's most famous beaches.

stops.title: Stackpole Centre (National Trust)
stops.description: Cottages and camping facilities near Stackpole Quay, ideal for families exploring the area.

stops.title: Surfing at Freshwater West
stops.description: Enjoy the waves at Freshwater West, a popular surfing spot.

wetAlt.title: Carew Castle and Tidal Mill
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic castle and mill.

budgetAlt.title: Beach walk at Freshwater West
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a long walk at one of Wales' best surf beaches.

stops.title: Cafe Mor
stops.description: Street food cafe at Freshwater West.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Pembrokeshire weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Be prepared for rain and wind, even if the forecast is sunny.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in coastal areas during peak season, especially around St Davids and Tenby. Parking at popular beaches like Whitesands and Barafundle can fill up quickly, so arrive early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for boat trips, coasteering, kayaking, and surfing lessons, especially during school holidays. Campsites also require advance booking.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for coasteering and kayaking. Participants should be comfortable swimming in the sea.
